alert.note: Alert for Cape Fairweather to Cape Suckling Coastal Area; Salisbury Sound to Cape Fairweather Coastal Area (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 19 at 5:30PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...VERY HEAVY RAIN AND RISING SNOW LEVELS EXPECTED THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING NORTHEAST GULF COAST AND PORTIONS OF THE EASTERN GULF COAST... An atmospheric river late this week into the weekend will bring very heavy rain, warming temperatures, rising snow levels, and a threat of flooding. A Flood Watch is now in effect for the region. A short break is possible Thursday before heavy rain starts Thursday night and persists for much of the weekend. Rainfall amounts of 6 to 8 inches are possible from Thursday evening through Saturday night for Yakutat, Elfin Cove, and Pelican. Snow levels are forecast to rise to 3,000 to 6,000 feet. Heavy rain along with a melting mountain snowpack will increase the risk of minor flooding issues. Rain over deep snow on top of structures and rooftops could challenge load limits across Yakutat. Please stay tuned to local updates should further flood bulletins be issued.
